title: Make vehicle manufacture installer work for new composer
body:
Make the installer work for new latest composer build.

- Removed hlfv11 folder as we no longer need to differentiate between 1.0 and 1.1
- Updated install.sh.in to use network install and start instead of network deploy
- Updated install.sh.in to use a new connection profile
- Extracts sample networks version from package.json for use in code

title: Vehicle Manufacture demo was not building
body:
Vehicle Manufacture demo was not building for hlfv1 or hlvf11.
This fixes #126

The COMPOSER-VERSION in build.sh for hlfv1 was changed from 'latest'
to '0.16.5' to fix a compatibility issue.

The build.sh for hlfv11 placeholder VEHICLE-LIFECYCLE-VERSION
replaced with VEHICLE-MANUFACTURE-VERSION.
The vehicle-manufacture-network.bna was added to the PAYLOAD of
the install.sh.
The NODE-RED-VERSION changed to 'latest'

Added instructions to run the demo against hlfv11 to the README

Signed-off-by: Robert Miroballi <rmiroballi@gmail.com>

title: Fix Vehicle Manufacture Demo
body:
Vehicle Manufacture demo was not building for hlfv1 or hlvf11. This fixes #126

The composer-version for hlfv1 was changed from 'latest' to '0.16.5' to fix a compatibility issue.

The build.sh had an incorrect placeholder fixed (VEHICLE-LIFECYCLE-VERSION to VEHICLE-MANUFACTURE-VERSION), and the vehicle-manufacture-network.bna was added to the PAYLOAD of the install.sh.

Added instructions to run the demo against hlfv11 to the README

title: Temporary fix until node-red release node8 docker image
Improvements based on improvement proposals
body: PR based on improvements specified in https://github.com/hyperledger/composer/issues/3130﻿ # Changes made ## General - Changed vehicle-lifecycle naming to vehicle-manufacture - Configured applications for running in iframes ## Installer - Updated references to vehicle-lifecycle-network business network to be vehicle-manufacture-network - Updated flows.json to remove previous Node-RED implementation and replaced it with a solution that listens for an UpdateOrderStatusEvent and sends and email if status is updated to delivery, the user paul has an email set and the user of the demo has configured the send email node. - Added install for using fabric v1.1 which installs against composer @next - Install now listens for an environment variable of DEMO_FABRIC_VERSION if unset it defaults to fabric 1.0 and composer @latest, if set to hlfv11 it uses fabric 1.1 and composer @next ## Car builder - Updated config to include reference to the REST server details - Updated app.js to return the JSON config unless the environment variable REST_SERVER_CONFIG is set with the REST server details. - Updated building screen to show tick when selecting trim and extra options - Updated building screen to prevent submission without filling in trim, colour and interior details for the car - Updated building screen to submit PlaceOrder transaction to REST server - Updated PlaceOrder request format to reflect changes in the business network - Updated status screen to listen to websockets coming from the REST server ## Manufacturing - Updated config to include reference to the REST server details - Added app.set to server/app.js that stores value from config file or if set the environment variable REST_SERVER_CONFIG - Updated websocket in server/app.js to prevent app death on disconnection from remote and set it to use the config set so that it listens to the REST server for events - Removed vehicles and transactions endpoints. - Added orders endpoint to retrieve PlaceOrder transactions using the REST server and combine with retrieved UpdateOrderStatus transactions to handle that order assets no longer store an array of the updates placed on them - Added updateOrderStatus endpoint to submit UpdateOrderStatus transactions via the REST server - Updated dashboard controller loading of statusUpdates to handle the way they are returned by the orders endpoint - Updated dashboard controller to use a single websocket for all events - Updated updating of order status' in dashboard controller to use updateOrderStatus endpoint ## VDA - Updated config to include reference to the REST server details - Added app.set to server/app.js that stores value from config file or if set the environment variable REST_SERVER_CONFIG - Updated websocket in server/app.js to prevent app death on disconnection from remote and set it to use the config set so that it listens to the REST server for events - Removed suspicious vehicles page - Removed suspicious vehicles number from header - Updated dashboard controller to work with v0.17.0 and remove composer events from VDA list e.g. AddUser. - Updated daashboard controller to display the identities involved in the transaction correctly by name rather than using hard coded defaults - Updated to use a single websocket to listen for events coming from the REST server # Relies upon - [ ] vehicle-manufacture-network being created as a sample in http://github.com/hyperledger/composer-sample-networks - [ ] install will only function if docker image released using new vehicle-manufacture naming - [ ] hlfv11 installer's node red flow relies on updated composer node red modules available @next # PLEASE DO NOT MERGE UNTIL RELIED UPON TASKS ARE COMPLETE

title: Add pm2 to demo, fix manufacturing package name
body:
The Docker images for the vehicle lifecycle demo can crash sometimes, but because they don't use pm2 the images go into the stopped state. This means that the user needs to manually restart them to continue using the demo.

- Install pm2 and use `pm2-docker` to run the applications
- Upgrade the applications to Node.js 8
- Fix the name of the manufacturing package

title: Node-RED flows do not work due to use of PeerAdmin
body:
https://github.com/hyperledger/composer/issues/670

The Node-RED flows are configured to use PeerAdmin, which is not bound to a business network administrator, so the Node-RED flows do not work - they get connection errors! 🐧

body:
As a network starter, I can bind an initial set of identities to participants at deployment time #670

Fix the vehicle lifecycle demo so that it works with Composer 0.14.0 by binding the admin identity as a business network administrator during deployment. As far as I can tell, the rest should work, as we are sharing the `.composer-credentials` folder across all of the Docker images used in the vehicle lifecycle demo...
